thread.title: Local veterans display art at the War Memorial Center
thread.title_full: Local veterans display art at the War Memorial Center

author: Jenna Wells
title: Local veterans display art at the War Memorial Center
text: Local veterans display art at the War Memorial Center [Jenna Wells](/bios/jenna-wells) - 1:34 [Packers fans gather at pep rally ahead of playoff matchup with...] - 2:21 [Voters to decide if Grafton, Saukville will merge their fire...] - 1:43 [Anonymous tip leads to arrest of man accused in string of armed...] - 2:18 [Packers fans gear up, fly out to support team’s playoff run] - 2:21 [Quicker emergency response times on Milwaukee’s south side...] - 1:31 [Residents from Cudahy fire still waiting to return to apartment...] - 3:01 [Wind Chill Advisory for some, along with a chilly weekend --...] - 0:39 [Dinky Rink reopens at Milwaukee Public Market] - 2:27 [Kwik Trip sells more than 38 million glazers in 2023] - 4:15 [Monster Jam revs into Fiserv Forum this weekend] - 1:56 [Meet CBS 58’s Pet of the Week: Sunny] MILWAUKEE (CBS 58) -- Art of all types is on display for the public locations across the city from 5:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m., and tomorrow from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. One of the locations is the War Memorial Center on North Lincoln Memorial Drive. In the Veterans Gallery on the second floor, a photography exhibit is on display, called "Veterans in Focus." It features photos taken by 12 veterans throughout southeastern Wisconsin. The photography was part of their recreation therapy through the Milwaukee VA Center. "Getting out with the camera just kind of takes their mind off daily stressors. It really helps focus what the subject is," said Courtney Zeller, recreation therapist at the Va Medical Center. "Being with groups of veterans, it gives you that secure, camaraderie feeling," said Jeffry Peterson, US Navy Veteran. s
